history.proof: hauto lq: on drew: off use: Z.le_ge, Z.mul_le_mono_neg_l, Z.ge_le, Z.le_neq, Z.mul_comm, Z.mul_0_r unfold: Z.ge, Z.lt.

ctx: intros n m p Hnm Hp0.
exceptions.exn: In environment n, m, p : Z Hnm : m >= n Hp0 : 0 >= p Unable to unify "(?M1410 * p ?= m * p) = Lt" with "(p * n ?= p * m) = Lt".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall n m p : Z, m >= n -> 0 >= p -> Z.mul p n >= Z.mul p m

Premises:
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
Zge_trans : forall n m p : Z, n >= m -> m >= p -> n >= p
Zmult_ge_compat_r : forall n m p : Z, n >= m -> p >= 0 -> n * p >= m * p
Zmult_ge_compat_l : forall n m p : Z, n >= m -> p >= 0 -> p * n >= p * m
Zmult_ge_compat : forall n m p q : Z, n >= p -> m >= q -> p >= 0 -> q >= 0 -> n * m >= p * q
Zmult_ge_reg_r : forall n m p : Z, p > 0 -> n * p >= m * p -> n >= m
Zplus_ge_compat_l : forall n m p : Z, n >= m -> p + n >= p + m
Zplus_ge_reg_l : forall n m p : Z, p + n >= p + m -> n >= m
Z.mul_le_mono_nonneg_l : forall n m p : Z, 0 <= p -> n <= m -> p * n <= p * m
Z.mul_le_mono_nonneg_r : forall n m p : Z, 0 <= p -> n <= m -> n * p <= m * p
Z.mul_reg_r : forall n m p : Z, p <> 0 -> n * p = m * p -> n = m
Z.mul_le_mono_nonpos_r : forall n m p : Z, p <= 0 -> n <= m -> m * p <= n * p
Zmult_lt_compat_l : forall n m p : Z, 0 < p -> n < m -> p * n < p * m
Z.mul_le_mono_nonpos_l : forall n m p : Z, p <= 0 -> n <= m -> p * m <= p * n
Z.le_lt_trans : forall n m p : Z, n <= m -> m < p -> n < p
Z.lt_le_trans : forall n m p : Z, n < m -> m <= p -> n < p
Z.le_trans : forall n m p : Z, n <= m -> m <= p -> n <= p
Z.mul_le_mono_nonneg : forall n m p q : Z, 0 <= n -> n <= m -> 0 <= p -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q
Z.mul_lt_mono_neg_r : forall p n m : Z, p < 0 -> n < m < -> m * p < n * p
Z.mul_le_mono_pos_r : forall n m p : Z, 0 < p -> n <= m < -> n * p <= m * p
Z.mul_lt_mono_pos_l : forall p n m : Z, 0 < p -> n < m < -> p * n < p * m
Z.mul_lt_mono_pos_r : forall p n m : Z, 0 < p -> n < m < -> n * p < m * p
Z.mul_le_mono_pos_l : forall n m p : Z, 0 < p -> n <= m < -> p * n <= p * m
Zplus_le_compat_l : forall n m p : Z, n <= m -> p + n <= p + m
Zplus_le_reg_l : forall n m p : Z, p + n <= p + m -> n <= m
Z.mul_lt_mono_nonpos : forall n m p q : Z, m <= 0 -> n < m -> q <= 0 -> p < q -> m * q < n * p

```coq
intros n m p Hnm Hp0.
apply Zmult_ge_compat_r with (p:=p) (m:=m); auto.
Qed.
```

original: intros n m p Hnm Hp0. apply Zmult_ge_compat_r with (p:=p) (m:=m); auto.
